alert.note: Alert for Garfield (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 6:52PM MDT until July 06 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following counties, Garfield and McCone. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 651 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in as little as 15 minutes. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rock Creek Rec Area and Nelson Creek Rec Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
